intro: Oncoba pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered oncoba, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color and are followed by small, berry-like fruits. Oncoba pauciflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
